intro: Sclerochiton holstii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems that store water, making it drought-resistant. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, which contributes to its common name. Sclerochiton holstii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to arid environments.
